meanings.definition: A large rectangular piece of cotton or other fabric used as a covering on a bed.
meanings.sent1: Mom washed the sheet and put it back on the bed.
meanings.sent2: The white sheet felt soft against my skin as I lay down.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat turned the sheet into a makeshift tent.
meanings.sent4: The fog blanketed the valley like a ghostly sheet.
meanings.sent5: The sheet billowed in the wind like a giant sail.

meanings.definition: A thin, flat piece of material such as paper or metal.
meanings.sent1: He tore off a sheet of paper to write a note.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used a metal sheet to fix the car's body.
meanings.sent3: The magician pulled a sheet of paper out of his pocket, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as smooth as a sheet of silk.
meanings.sent5: The sheet of metal gleamed under the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A broad, flat expanse or surface.
meanings.sent1: The lake was calm, reflecting the sky like a sheet of glass.
meanings.sent2: The desert stretched out before us like an endless sheet of sand.
meanings.sent3: The children used the sheet of ice as a makeshift slide.
meanings.sent4: The city lights spread out below us like a sheet of stars.
meanings.sent5: The sheet of snow covered the ground like a soft blanket.
